what: A Collection of Datasets Containing Functional Data
title: A Collection of Datasets Containing Functional Data
A Collection of Datasets Containing Functional Data
text: can install development version gmeans GitHub :

title: Diffusion tensor imaging data — dti
text: Fractional anisotropy (FA) tract profiles corpus callosum (cca) right corticospinal tract (rcst). Accompanying tract profiles subject ID numbers, visit number, total number scans, multiple sclerosis case status Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (pasat) score. Data also include refund package another format.

title: Diffusion tensor imaging data — dti
text: tibble 382 rows 6 variables: id Subject ID visit visit number sex sex subject case multiple sclerosis case status cca fractional anisotropy (FA) tract profile corpus callosum rcst fractional anisotropy (FA) tract profile right corticospinal tract

title: Diffusion tensor imaging data — dti
text: use data example written work, please include following acknowledgment: “MRI/DTI data collected Johns Hopkins University Kennedy-Krieger Institute"

title: Running data — running
text: dataset includes kinematic data collected participants running various conditions, without backpacks different weights.

title: Running data — running
text: tibble 610 rows 49 variables: id subject identifier cond running condition side leg side step step number age age ht height wt body mass sex sex study study split_set validation set ankle_accl_ap ankle acceleration anterior-posterior ankle_accl_ml ankle acceleration medial-lateral ankle_accl_vt ankle acceleration vertical ankle_angle_ap ankle angle anterior-posterior ankle_angle_ml ankle angle medial-lateral ankle_angle_vt ankle angle vertical ankle_moment_ap ankle moment anterior-posterior ankle_moment_ml ankle moment medial-lateral ankle_moment_vt ankle moment vertical ankle_vel_ap ankle velocity anterior-posterior ankle_vel_ml ankle velocity medial-lateral ankle_vel_vt ankle velocity vertical com_grf_ap whole body force anterior-posterior com_grf_ml whole body force medial-lateral com_grf_vt whole body force vertical hip_accl_ap hip acceleration anterior-posterior hip_accl_ml hip acceleration medial-lateral hip_accl_vt hip acceleration vertical hip_angle_ap hip angle anterior-posterior hip_angle_ml hip angle medial-lateral hip_angle_vt hip angle vertical hip_moment_ap hip moment anterior-posterior hip_moment_ml hip moment medial-lateral hip_moment_vt hip moment vertical hip_vel_ap hip velocity anterior-posterior hip_vel_ml hip velocity medial-lateral hip_vel_vt hip velocity vertical knee_accl_ap knee acceleration anterior-posterior knee_accl_ml knee acceleration medial-lateral knee_accl_vt knee acceleration vertical knee_angle_ap knee angle anterior-posterior knee_angle_ml knee angle medial-lateral knee_angle_vt knee angle vertical knee_moment_ap knee moment anterior-posterior knee_moment_ml knee moment medial-lateral knee_moment_vt knee moment vertical knee_vel_ap knee velocity anterior-posterior knee_vel_ml knee velocity medial-lateral knee_vel_vt knee velocity vertical

title: Running data — running
text: conditions follows: fastbw run 5 m/s backpack fastten run 5 m/s 10% body mass backpack fasttwe run 5 m/s 20% body mass backpack fback run 3.5 m/s 20% body mass backpack fbw run 3.5 m/s backpack modbw run 4 m/s backpack modten run 4 m/s 10% body mass backpack modtwe run 4 m/s 20% body mass backpack runt25 run 2.5 m/s backpack runt35 run 3.5 m/s backpack runt45 run 4.5 m/s backpack sback run self-chosen speed 20% body mass backpack sbw run self-chosen speed backpack slowbw run 3 m/s backpack slowten run 3 m/s 10% body mass backpack slowtw run 3 m/s 20% body mass backpack

title: Running data — running
text: Liew, X. B, Morris, S., Keogh, W. J, Appleby, B., Netto, K. (2016). “Effects two neuromuscular training programs running biomechanics load carriage: study protocol randomised controlled trial.” BMC Musculoskeletal Disorders, 17(1), 1-10. Liew, X. B, Morris, S., Netto, K. (2016). “effects load carriage joint work different running velocities.” Journal Biomechanics, 49(14), 3275-3280. Fukuchi, K R, Fukuchi, C, Duarte, Marcos (2017). “public dataset running biomechanics effects running speed lower extremity kinematics kinetics.” PeerJ, 5, e3298.
